intro: Baryxylum ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty baryxylum, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are usually ovate with a rough, textured surface. Baryxylum ferrugineum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
